H0.text: who led the conquest of the incas in south america. Hernán Cortés

H1.text: who led the conquest of the incas in south america. Vasco Núñez de Balboa

H2.text: who led the conquest of the incas in south america. Gonzalo Jiménez de Quesada

H3.text: who led the conquest of the incas in south america. Francisco Pizarro

A4.text: Francisco Pizarro was a Spanish conquistador, best known for his expeditions that led to the Spanish conquest of the Inca Empire.

A5.text: Pizarro founded the city of Lima on Peru's central coast on 6 January 1535, which he considered to be one of the most important things he had created in life.
